title: Ticket #7547: stream out or err fails for large files on 32 bit shadows
description:
LIGO reports that stream_out and stream_err fail when appending to a file > 32 bits worth. Investigation shows that we aren't setting O_LARGEFILE in the shadow and chirp remote system calls.

Investigation reveals that ligo @ cardiff may have been streaming to a file on NFS.
remarks:
2020-Mar-20 17:08:14 by jfrey:
Code Review

This change looks ok, but won't solve all large file problems with the 32-bit shadow. read(), write(), and lseek() calls all have a 32-bit offset/size value.

2020-Apr-06 21:56:35 by gthain:
After getting a login at Cardiff and seeing the problem live, we determined that it isn't a problem with NFS or 32 bit shadows. Rather, when user level checkpointing is on, an a job restarts, and stream output is on, the starter issues a remote system call to the shadow to seek to the end of the standard out or err.

Turns out there was a bug since time immemorial where the REMOTE_CONDOR_lseek remote system call always returns an int, not.an off_t or a long or a 64 bit quantity. And that causes problems when the file is > 32 bits long.

2020-Apr-07 13:37:53 by tlmiller:
Code Review

I agree with Jaime (code looks good but incomplete), but since this fixes a real problem, let's not hold it up.

You should probably update the release note to reflect the second patch.

2020-Apr-10 07:43:03 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080808 to v080809 using ticket-target-mover.
